p: Horticulture is an important economic sector in Colombia and has promising exportation prospects; however, most horticultural products face restrictions in countries such as Canada, the United States, and Japan, among others. These countries require that crops be grown using clean production systems, either organic agriculture or sustainable agriculture with minimal chemical pesticide use [ 1]. It is estimated that Colletotrichum gloeosporioides ( Glomerellaceae) caused losses in 48% of the vegetable crops grown in Colombia. Due to the excessive use of agrochemicals needed to control its spread, crops are unable to be exported, especially those grown by small farmers [ 2, 3]. Colletotrichum is a large genus of fungi that includes a significant number of major fungal pathogens that cause diseases in various tropical and subtropical vegetables. It was listed as the eighth most important group of phytopathogenic fungi in the world based on perceived scientific and economic significance [ 4].
